title: 105_s170
content: The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" amends definitions in wire and electronic communications laws to include communication made through a clone pager. It also prohibits the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers without authorization. Chapter 206 is amended accordingly. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in the regulations regarding pen registers and trap and trace devices. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in the regulations regarding pen registers and trap and trace devices. The amendments involve inserting "clone pager" alongside "trap and trace device" in various sections, ensuring their inclusion in the regulations. The legislation amends Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code to include clone pagers in regulations concerning pen registers and trap and trace devices. It authorizes the use of clone pagers in ongoing criminal investigations upon court approval based on relevance certification. The legislation amends Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code to include clone pagers in regulations concerning pen registers and trap and trace devices for ongoing criminal investigations. The legislation amends Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code to include clone pagers in regulations concerning pen registers and trap and trace devices for ongoing criminal investigations. The amendments involve inserting clone pagers in various subsections alongside trap and trace devices. The legislation amends Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code to include clone pagers in regulations concerning pen registers and trap and trace devices for ongoing criminal investigations. This involves ordering providers of paging services to assist law enforcement officers in using clone pagers unobtrusively. The legislation amends Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code to include clone pagers in regulations concerning pen registers and trap and trace devices for ongoing criminal investigations. This involves ordering providers of paging services to assist law enforcement officers in using clone pagers unobtrusively and with minimal interference. The legislation amends Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code to include clone pagers in regulations concerning pen registers and trap and trace devices for ongoing criminal investigations. Clone pagers are defined as numeric display devices that receive communications intended for another numeric display paging device. The legislation amends Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code to include clone pagers in regulations concerning pen registers and trap and trace devices for ongoing criminal investigations. Passed the Senate November 7, 1997.
